refnamediv.refpurpose: Rendering RGB buffers to X drawables.

refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The XlibRGB set of functions is a port of the GdkRGB library to use plain Xlib and X drawables. You can use these functions to render RGB buffers into drawables very quickly with high-quality dithering.

refsect2.title: enum XlibRgbDither
refsect2.para: These values are used to specify which dithering method should be used. XLIB_RGB_DITHER_NONE will use no dithering and simply map the colors in an RGB buffer to the closest colors that the display can provide. XLIB_RGB_DITHER_NORMAL will provide dithering only on pseudocolor displays. XLIB_RGB_DITHER_MAX will provide dithering on pseudocolor and 16-bit truecolor or “high color” displays.

listitem.simpara: Specifies dithering only on pseudocolor displays.
Specifies dithering on high color displays.

refsect2.title: xlib_rgb_init ()
refsect2.para: Initializes the XlibRGB machinery with the default depth. If you use this function XlibRGB will automatically pick the best visual available on your display. This function or xlib_rgb_init_with_depth() must be called before using any of the other functions in XlibRGB.

refsect2.title: xlib_rgb_init_with_depth ()
refsect2.para: Initializes the XlibRGB machinery with a particular depth you specify, instead of automatically picking the best depth in the display. This function or xlib_rgb_init() must be called before using any of the other functions in XlibRGB.

listitem.simpara: Visual depth to use for color substitution tables. This must be one of the supported visual depths in the specified display.

refsect2.title: xlib_rgb_xpixel_from_rgb ()
refsect2.para: Converts an RGB triplet into the closest color that XlibRGB visual can handle.

listitem.simpara: 32-bit representation of an RGB value, specified as 0x00RRGGBB.
X pixel value that corresponds to the closest color in the XlibRGB visual and colormap.

refsect2.title: xlib_rgb_gc_set_foreground ()
refsect2.para: This is a convenience function to set the foreground of a GC from an RGB triplet. It calls xlib_rgb_xpixel_from_rgb() internally and uses the returned pixel value to set the GC's foreground.

listitem.simpara: 32-bit representation of an RGB value, specified as 0x00RRGGBB.

refsect2.title: xlib_rgb_gc_set_background ()
refsect2.para: This is a convenience function to set the background of a GC from an RGB triplet. It calls xlib_rgb_xpixel_from_rgb() internally and uses the returned pixel value to set the GC's background.

listitem.simpara: 32-bit representation of an RGB value, specified as 0x00RRGGBB.

refsect2.title: xlib_draw_rgb_image ()
refsect2.programlisting: void xlib_draw_rgb_image (Drawable drawable, GC gc, int x, int y, int width, int height, XlibRgbDither dith, unsigned char *rgb_buf, int rowstride);
refsect2.para: Renders an RGB buffer to a drawable. Pixels are specified as RGB triplets with 8 bits per channel. An image will thus look like an RGBRGBRGBRGB sequence of 8-bit values. This function does not let you specify dither offsets; applications that need to render partial regions of a buffer to build the final image should use xlib_draw_rgb_image_dithalign() instead.

listitem.simpara: Leftmost coordinate of the destination rectangle.
Upper coordinate of the destination rectangle.
Width of the destination rectangle, in pixels.
Height of the destination rectangle, in pixels.
Pointer to the pixel in the RGB buffer that corresponds to the upper-left corner of the rectangular region to render.
Offset between pixel rows in the RGB buffer, in bytes.

refsect2.title: xlib_draw_rgb_image_dithalign ()
refsect2.programlisting: void xlib_draw_rgb_image_dithalign (Drawable drawable, GC gc, int x, int y, int width, int height, XlibRgbDither dith, unsigned char *rgb_buf, int rowstride, int xdith, int ydith);
refsect2.para: Renders an RGB buffer to a drawable. Pixels are specified as RGB triplets with 8 bits per channel. An image will thus look like an RGBRGBRGBRGB sequence of 8-bit values. This function lets you specify a pair of dither offsets. It should be used when you need to render regions of an RGB buffer separately to form the final image; the dither offsets let you align the dither mask appropriately.

listitem.simpara: Leftmost coordinate of the destination rectangle.
Upper coordinate of the destination rectangle.
Width of the destination rectangle, in pixels.
Height of the destination rectangle, in pixels.
Pointer to the pixel in the RGB buffer that corresponds to the upper-left corner of the rectangular region to render.
Offset between pixel rows in the RGB buffer, in bytes.
X offset for the dither mask.
Y offset for the dither mask.

refsect2.title: xlib_draw_rgb_32_image ()
refsect2.programlisting: void xlib_draw_rgb_32_image (Drawable drawable, GC gc, int x, int y, int width, int height, XlibRgbDither dith, unsigned char *buf, int rowstride);
refsect2.para: This function is analogous to xlib_draw_rgb_image(), but it lets you use 32-bit RGB buffers with pixels specified as 0xRRGGBB00. The least-significant 8 bits are actually discarded. This function can lead to faster results than xlib_draw_rgb_image() since the pixels are aligned on 32-bit boundaries.

listitem.simpara: Leftmost coordinate of the destination rectangle.
Upper coordinate of the destination rectangle.
Width of the destination rectangle, in pixels.
Height of the destination rectangle, in pixels.
Pointer to the pixel in the RGB buffer that corresponds to the upper-left corner of the rectangular region to render.
Offset between pixel rows in the RGB buffer, in bytes.

refsect2.programlisting: void xlib_draw_gray_image (Drawable drawable, GC gc, int x, int y, int width, int height, XlibRgbDither dith, unsigned char *buf, int rowstride);
refsect2.para: Renders a grayscale buffer to a drawable. Pixels are specified as 8-bit intensity values. An image will thus look as a GGGGGG sequence of 8-bit values.

Upper coordinate of the destination rectangle.

Offset between pixel rows in the grayscale buffer, in pixels.
